name: RUY LOPEZ
idea: The Bb5 puts pressure on the Nc6 which defends the e5 pawn. White is not looking to win e5 immediately (Bxc6 dxc6 Nxe5? allows ...Qd4! recovering the pawn), but creates lasting tension. The goal is to build slowly with c3-d4 to dominate the center. This is the most analyzed opening in chess history.
errors_white: Bxc6 too early: gives the bishop pair to Black without compensation
d4 without c3: after ...exd4, White loses time recovering
Neglecting castling: the King in the center becomes a target
errors_black: Premature ...Nxe4?: falls into the Mortimer or Berlin trap
...f6?: terribly weakens the h5-e8 diagonal, invites Qh5+
...a6 Ba4 b5 Bb3 Na5?: the Knight on the edge of the board is misplaced
development: Develop to e3 (solid) or g5 (aggressive on f6)
Go to c3 (classical) or d2 (Breyer) to support e4
Centralize on e1 (pressure on e-file) and d1 (support d4)
Castle quickly on the kingside, it's a priority
Stay flexible - often e2 to connect the Rooks
Prepare c3 then d4 for an ideal pawn center

traps.name: Mortimer Trap
traps.desc: After 4.Nc3 Nd4?? 5.Nxe5! wins a pawn because the Nd4 falls afterwards. AVOID: Never play ...Nd4 so early! Develop normally with ...Nf6, ...Be7, ...0-0.

traps.name: Noah's Ark Trap
traps.desc: After ...a6 Ba4 b5 Bb3, Black plays ...c5-c4 trapping the Bishop! AVOID (White): Retreat to Bc2 in time, or play a4 to break the pawn chain.

traps.name: Tarrasch Trap
traps.desc: After 5.Bxc6 dxc6 6.Nxe5?? 6...Qd4! attacks e5 AND e4 - Black recovers with advantage. AVOID (White): Don't take e5! Play 0-0 or d3 instead.

variants.name: Morphy Defense
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 f1b5 a7a6 b5a4 g8f6 e1g1 f8e7 f1e1
variants.white_plan: Play c3 then d4 to open the center. The Re1 supports e4 and prepares the attack.
variants.black_plan: Develop ...b5, ...Bb7, castle, then counter-attack in the center with ...d5 at the right moment.

variants.name: Berlin Defense
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 f1b5 g8f6 e1g1 f6e4 d2d4 e4d6 b5c6 d7c6 d4e5 d6f5
variants.white_plan: Technical endgame! Exploit the kingside pawn majority and Black's doubled pawns.
variants.black_plan: The bishop pair compensates for the doubled pawns. Activate the King early and aim for endgames.

variants.name: Marshall Gambit
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 f1b5 a7a6 b5a4 g8f6 e1g1 f8e7 f1e1 b7b5 a4b3 e8g8 c2c3 d7d5
variants.white_plan: Accept the gambit with 9.exd5 Nxd5 10.Nxe5 Nxe5 11.Rxe5. Defend precisely!
variants.black_plan: Furious attack! After ...Bd6, ...Qh4, ...Bg4 Black has a dangerous initiative against the King.
